subject: Re: [junit] Including the quote on the value of the property ?
msgSnippet: Hi Alex, You might have more luck with this question on the ant-user mailing list. You don t include detail of the actual emit.event target, and that s where
messageBody:
Hi Alex,

You might have more luck with this question on the ant-user mailing list.

You don't include detail of the actual "emit.event" target, and that's
where you would need to make changes. I assume from your description
that it makes use of the <exec> Ant task.

If ${message.text} has spaces in it but you want it treated as a single
param on the command line, you can use a nested <ant value="">:

<exec executable="emit_event">
<arg value="-msg"/>
<arg value="${message.text}"/>
</exec>

See http://ant.apache.org/manual/using.html#arg for more info.

Cheers,
-Brendan
http://www.cenqua.com - Software Tools for Continuous Quality

Alex De Lara wrote:
>
>
> Here's something that I can't get it quite right
>
> <antcall target="emit.event" >
> <param name="message.text" value=""Isolation level"" />
> </antcall>
>
> What's the correct way to include the double quotes in the value so
> when the application underneath receives the value it comes
> with actually "Isolation level 1" i.e as when you type in the
> command line
>
> ./emit_event -msg "Isolation level 1"
>
>
>
>
>
>
